message+desc:
Where is it? 
Espa√±a, Manila

What is it like?
University of Sto. Tomas is one of the largest Catholic universities in the world. It's also the Philippines‚Äôs oldest. Founded on April 28, 1611, the university boasts providing more than 400 years of quality education in the Philippines.

How to get there: 
Fly into Manila through one of more than 30 international airlines. You can also fly in from any major Philippine city.

Or take a bus from any major city in Luzon.

Or take a boat from any major Philippine port.

Fun Fact: 
The university has its share of remarkable alumni, including four Philippine presidents: Manuel Quezon, Sergio Osme√±a, Jose Laurel, and Diosdado Macapagal.

Photo by/Headline by: 
George Tapan/Brandon Dollente

Unleash your inner wizard or witch by feasting on dishes that aren't your typical muggle fare. Platform 1094 serves mains like the Pesto Mayo Pork Ribs and Suhnitzel Sous-vide Duck Breast. message+desc:
Where is it? 
Davao, Mindanao

What is it like? 
Kadayawan Festival, the annual fiesta of Davao City, is celebrated during the third week of August. Highlights include floral floats, street-dancing competitions and exhibits that showcase the island's products.

Fun Fact: 
The celebration is a venue for celebrity sightseeing. Popular Philippine celebs who are based in Manila are known to fly all the way to the south just to be part of Kadayawan.

Photo by/Author: 
Tourism Department Philippines/Jao Bautista

message+desc:
Where is it? 
Coron, Palawan

What is it like? 
Coron‚Äôs Kayangan Lake is the cleanest lake in Asia. Here, the warm sea and the cold mountain spring combine to create a pool of clear water perfect for swimming. To add to that, the lake is enclosed by towering limestone mountains. 

How to get there: 
Fly from Manila to Busuanga, then transfer to a van bound for Coron.

Fun Fact: 
Kayangan Lake is a 10-15 minute hike through a scenic, tropical rainforest.

Photo by/Headline by: 
Raul Montifar/Rachel Teotico
comments: I've been there with my Kids. Its absolutely phantastic.

#FilmTourism #Batman #TheDarkNightRises #IncredibleIndia

message+desc:
Where is it? 
Bantayan Island, Cebu

What is it like? 
Bantayan once served as a Spanish base against Moro invasions. That's why a walk around can transport you centuries back. You can see traces of its heritage in the old Spanish-era houses and dilapidated fort ruins. Mangroves and palm trees line the shores of Sugar Beach, Paradise Beach and Virgin Island.

Fun Fact: 
This island's watchtowers gave it the name ‚ÄúBantayan sa Hari‚Äù (Watchtower of the King). This was later shortened to ‚ÄúBantayan,‚Äù the name it's known as today.

Photo by/Author: 
George Tapan/Donna Dimayuga

Here's the sunset at Madridejos Bantayan Island Cebu :D$$It's fun to be here..nice beach...Bantayan Island..$$Steve Lohbeck Jun Reyes kindly refrain from posting spam on the page to prevent being banned. message+desc:
Pinoys, do you recognize what these are? Clue: they‚Äôre cool, refreshing and the best way to enjoy them is to bore a hole through the plastic and suck out the juices! Tell us if you know what these unique Pinoy summer treats are called! 

Photo from http://oggi-icandothat.blogspot.com
comments:
Ice candy. We have these different flavor, buko, ube, avocado, papaya, fruit salad, mango, chocolate, we even have milk w/ mashed sweet potato & ground peanut. LAMI KAAYO, TIMING SA TAG INIT.$$We have them in the UK. 
My grandmother had them in the freezer part of her fridge and called them ice pops. They are fruit flavoured,
If we were good when we stayed and had gone shopping she would treat us on hot days.$$Growing up in Silay City, Negros Occidental, these was known as "a-go-go" to us. Sounds funny right? I have no idea of the etymology behind that word. My husband, who grew up in a sugar central compound for their employees' residences, would sell these in the hot summer months to the hacienda workers in the fields.  My favorite flavor was creamed corn and milk.$$Ice candy. i remember we sell these in our grocery store. vanilla monggo,  vanilla mango,  vanilla buco. and chocolate flavor.  yummy :)$$ice candies! I want some please.. freezer pops in Pinas, these I miss especially the fresh buko ice candy of my Auntie Leonita!üòã$$hah! I always ask friends going back home to buy me ice candy plastics so I can make some and let my kids enjoy what I enjoyed when I was their age, ice candy NZ made!$$Ice candy... i use to sell it during summer and make it myself. Dami flavors. Avocado, milk, coconut, mango & strawberry . Best seller is avocado.$$Love them. I make them during the summer.$$Ice candy of course paborito ko 'yan noon when  i was  growing up missed ko na 'yan cge lng when i go home nxt tym babawi ako,kakain ako ng marami he he he.$$Eula do you know/remember what these are? Oh how I miss the PI!$$Ya we would go to the local school to buy for 5 php I think. Once I squeezed too hard and the thing went flying out my hand and onto the ground.$$those are Ice candies  as what we called in the Philippines....$$I seen some of these in the freezer the other day$$in scotland we call them icepoles.mmmmm$$Dave Jaska... You'll have to try this if you come across any vendors that sell ice candyüëçüèº$$I love to eat ice candy :P$$Avocado,monggo and milk with young coconut /buko for me please...

message+desc:
Where is it?
Bulabog Beach, Boracay

What is it?
Kiteboarders discovered the windy side of Boracay ten years ago. But this isn't the only place they flock to.  There are near-perfect wind conditions in provinces up north in Luzon, and in Palawan.

Fun Fact:
Kiteboarding is an extreme water sport that combines techniques from wakeboarding, windsurfing, surfing, paragliding and even gymnastics.

Photo taken from the Philippine Department of Tourism

message+desc:
Where is it?
Zambales, Luzon

How to Get There:
Take a bus to Zambales from Caloocan or Cubao (seven hours).

What is it?
In March of 1991, a series of earthquakes occurred for nearly 3 months, evidently showing that Mt. Pinatubo was about to erupt. On June 15, the volcano went down in history for having the second largest terrestrial explosion of the 20th century, effects of which were felt worldwide. 

Fun Fact:
The volcano's crater is now a favorite tourist destination of hikers (even the amateur ones, thanks to the fairly easy trails)! A refreshing dip in the lake awaits those who want to cool down after hours of hiking. Kayaks are available too! 

Photo by Alvi Siongco

message+desc:
Share to win 2 pairs of Adrian Pang's 'Rabbit Hole' opening show tickets!

We know some of you have been really curious about Adrian Pang's kick-ass theatre company, Pangdemonium!

So in this month's contest, we will be giving away TWO pairs of complimentary tickets to Pangdemonium's brand new season opening show "Rabbit Hole" to TWO lucky Facebook Fans, courtesy of Pangdemonium! There is no better time than now to familiarize yourself with Pangdemonium's work! And whats even better - you get to bring a friend along with you too! To qualify for our contest, all you have to do is:

1. Like the Pangdemonium Productions facebook page
2. Like the TheSmartLocal.com facebook page
3. Share this post and comment on it "Liked & Shared!"

Terms & Conditions
- Two pairs of complimentary Pangdemonium tickets will be given out as prizes (total 4 tickets), one PAIR of tickets to each of the two winners.
- The contest will end on Monday, 22nd April and be decided via random draw. The winners will be announced shortly after confirmation.
- Winners are required to contact TheSmartLocal or check their inbox's "other folder" for messages once the results are announced. If we are unable to contact you within 3 days, the tickets will be given to the next in line.
- These giveaway tickets are for "Rabbit Hole" showing on Sunday, the 28th of April at 3pm later this month. Winners are required to come down to collect the tickets and there will be a casual photograph taken with Pangdemonium! staff. The ticket dates aren't able to be changed so if you win, please keep that date free!
 
-----

Curious to learn more about Pangdemonium!? Check out the feature we did a while ago over here! http://www.thesmartlocal.com/read/pangdemonium-ensues-2013-season-tickets-and-show-information

message+desc:
Sejong Center, which will be hosting <Sebasti√£o Salgado Genesis 2014>, is located close to Gyeongbokgung Palace.

Why not visit Gyeongbok Palace today?
As the first royal palace built in 1395, Gyeongbokgung Palace is considered the heart and center of the Joseon Dynasty.

<Sebasti√£o Salgado Genesis 2014> will be held until Jan. 15, 2015.

Get your tickets here: http://bit.ly/1vMwHDE
comments: I love this Palace! ~Natalie~$$Actually this palace is a reconstruction. In 1592 the Japanese destroyed it. It was rebuilt in 1867. A fire in 1876 destroyed some buildings which were rebuilt in 1888. Then, in 1915, the Japanese levelled all buildings and built their colonial administration building on the grounds. This building was not removed until 1996. The reconstruction of the complex was finally completed in 2010. Therefore the oldest buildings is no older than c.1990.$$Beautiful reconstruction of the original palace.  One of my favourite places to wander around while in Seoul.$$wow the first royal palace built in 1395

message+desc:
Where is it?
Tubbataha Reef, Palawan

How to Get There:
Fly from Manila to Puerto Princesa, then take a live-aboard boat to Tubbataha.

What is it?
The Manta alfredi, or "reef manta," is a common animal to be found cruising along  Tubbataha Reef in Palawan. 

Fun Fact:
Manta rays have no bones ‚Äî the skeleton is made completely out of tough cartilage.

Photo by / Headline by:
N. Hana / Magnus Ahmad

message+desc:
Calling out all VK fans! The opening ceremony of ‚ÄúSang Sang Gil‚Äù will be held on September 16, 2015! A free one day tour around Changwon will be offered to the first 50 fans who registers! If you're interested, and you will be in Korea on the day, don't miss out the amazing opportunity! Click on the post for more details! :D

#ImagineYourKorea #WriteYourNameinKorea #FreeTour #Changwon #VisitKoreaFree 1 Day Tour of ‚ÄòSang Sang Gil‚Äô offered to our fans!

Currently Imagine your Korea is running ‚ÄúWrite Your Name in Korea (http://www.imagineyourkorea.com/write-your-name?lang=en)‚Äù campaign. Participants to this campaign will have a chance to win a trip to Korea and to have their name engraved on ‚ÄúSang Sang Gil (imagination road)‚Äù located in the  city of Changwon, the southern coast of Korea.

On Sept 16, 2015, there will be an Opening Ceremony of ‚ÄúSang Sang Gil‚Äù and we, Korea Tourism Organization, are pleased to invite 50 fans. (Available as 1 accompanying person per 1 fan) If you are interested, please send us an e-mail now! We will confirm it in a first-come first-served basis.

Participating fans will be offered free transportation between Seoul and Changwon, one free lunch, free admission to tourist attractions, souvenirs and one-day travel insurance.  English / Japanese / Chinese tour guides (in total 3) will be assisting the group.

‚ñ† Tour Date : Sept 16, 2015 (Wednesday)
‚ñ† Tour Itinerary (The following schedule is tentative. Finalized itinerary will be sent to the confirmed participants.)
- 06:30 Depart Seoul / Board the tour bus at Sports Complex (Seoul Subway Line #2)
- 11:30 Arrive Changwon ‚ÄúSang Sang Gil‚Äù
- 12:00-13:30 Attend the Opening Ceremony and Tour of ‚ÄòSang Sang Gil‚Äô
- 13:30-14:30 Lunch
- 14:30-16:00 Tour of Changwon  (Moonshin Art Museum & Gagopa Kkoburang-gil Wall Painting Street)
- 16:00 Depart Changwon
- 21:00 Arrive Seoul
‚ñ† How to Send an E-mail: Send an e-mail to sangsanggilkto@gmail.com with your and your accompanying person‚Äôs ‚ë† First Name / Last Name (on your passport) ‚ë° Cell Phone No  ‚ë¢Nationality  ‚ë£Gender  ‚ë§ Date of birth
‚ñ† Application Deadline: Sept 8, 2015 (Tuesday) / Confirmation e-mail will be sent to applicants by Sept 11 (Friday).
Disclaimer: We will not use or disclose any personal information collected other than for the purpose for the ‚ÄòFree 1 Day Tour of ‚ÄòSang Sang Gil‚Äô.‚Äô We will not use, sell or disclose personal information for any other purpose without your consent unless required or authorized by law.

Imagine your Korea!

#ImagineyourKorea #WriteYourNameinKorea

The mega Japan Food Town just opened TODAY with 16 top Japanese restaurants, taking over Isetan in Wisma Atria.

Imagine a 20,000 sqft area filled with the Japanese food from all over the world, with prices that start from $10. THAT'S WHAT IT IS!

Follow TheSmartLocal.com > Liked > Set notifications to always > You'll never miss a post like this again!

Japan Food Town is a $8.5 million project backed up by the Japanese government and can seat up to 628-pax. It will "officially" open on July 16 2016 - but for now you can still visit some shops which have opened early. We imagine more will start to open each day.

How to get there: 
Wisma Atria, 435 Orchard Road Singapore 238877

More pictures and info on the shops that are open:
http://eatbook.sg/japan-food-town/

message+desc:
Can you imagine what these statues are made of?
The answer is vegetables, fruit, and flowers! 

‚ÄúTsukurimon Matsuri‚Äù (Mon Exhibitions) is a humorous and creative festival which expressing gratitude for a rich harvest.  This festival has its history of 300 years and this year, it will be held on September 23th and 24th takes place at Takaoka City, Toyama Prefecture.
Young and old, men and women of this area make ‚ÄúTsukurimon‚Äù and it normally takes a month to complete these statues. 
It is great pleasure what kind of ‚ÄúTsukurimon‚Äù works are made this year!

Related information;
‚ÄúToyama/Takaoka Area‚Äù
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/regional/toyama/toyama_takaoka.html
‚ÄúEvent list for September,‚Äù Takaoka City Tourism Association
http://www.takaoka.or.jp/event?yr=2014&month=9&dy=&cid=all&lang=en 
Tourist Information in Toyama
http://foreign.info-toyama.com/en/event/

message+desc:
The New York Times introduced one of JNTO's events in New York; showing an unusual tourism related video. 
The video shows how humanitarian efforts made by a Japanese diplomat and an employee of a tourism bureau to save Jews. 
It's less well known, but the tourism bureau played an important role in helping thousands of them during World War II. 

If you are interested, please check out the link below! 
http://www.nytimes.com/2014/03/06/nyregion/an-evacuation-of-jews-with-help-from-japan.html?ref=world&_r=1As Japan Week begins in New York City, a video about the roles of a diplomat and a tourist-bureau employee in saving Jews from the Nazis will be shown at Grand Central Terminal on Thursday.
comments: Glad to know this. Btw, aside from Schindler, Ernst Leitz II  was also helpful in the rescue effort of saving the Jews from the holocaust.$$Well done! Will we be able to see this video on YouTube?$$Blessed are the kind, helpful and benevolent people. They will be remembered till Eternity$$Please "LIKE" our page for an insider's guide to all things Japan! https://www.facebook.com/japandatravel$$And was not Japan an allie of Germany on War World II?$$This is a great story of a very brave and caring man! :-)$$More an individual story than politically.

message+desc:
Imagine you weren't allowed to throw away anything you've used like the styrofoam box you dabaoed your cai peng in. And instead had to accumulate all your waste in a box for ONE WEEK. We gave our team this challenge and here's what happened.

We created this video after learning Singaporeans generated 7.67 million tonnes of waste last year. That‚Äôs way too much. With this Zero Waste Challenge, let's see how little changes to our lifestyle can help make Singapore a much more environmentally-friendly country.

Thanks to NTUC FairPrice for making this video possible!

Watch the full video here: 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=G5LWcFH0jTE
comments: Nice one! Go Green is the new trend way of life!

message+desc:
Where is it?
Puerto Princesa, Palawan

How to Get There:
Fly into Puerto Princesa from Busuanga, Cebu, Davao, Iloilo or Manila. 

What is it?
The series of protruding limestone formations unique to Palawan make the province home to lakes as well. These lakes are formed when water is trapped in the spaces in between the limestone cliffs. 

Fun Fact:
A Palawan getaway wouldn‚Äôt be complete without limestone cliff diving. The otherworldly rock formations make a picturesque backdrop for jumpshot-off-the-cliff photos.

Photo by / Headline by:
George Tapan / Jao Bautista
comments: Also try climbing the oldest tree and go mountaineering at the highest peak in the Visayas at the Negros Oriental side(near Cebu city and Bacolod),view more photos @ my page of Canlaon city$$It's Coron Island, not PP....

message+desc:
Is anyone been to Maya Bay, Island Phi Phi? Do not hesitate to share your experience & tips to other travellers at below comment.

Maya bay is a wonderful bay surrounded by 100-meter high sheer cliffs. By being almost separated from the sea, it looks pretty much like a huge natural swimming pool that almost gives a feeling of privacy. The bay is made up three beaches in the bay, two tiny ones and the main beach, a 200m long stretch of white powdery sand and exceptionally clear water. It is where the movie "The Beach" was filmed.

#Share & #Tag anyone you would like to go on a #Vacation with!
#Like our page to explore the world's hidden gems with Tripviss
comments: Yep! Me and my bestie Kristin Lowe went there with hundreds of tourist :D

message+desc:
Don't you love this version of our MRT map? It's a lot more accurate too! :) Credit: Bernie Ng

Follow TheSmartLocal.com and never miss our biggest stories and shares again!

"I saw your recent post regarding future Singapore MRT/LRT maps and thought I‚Äôd throw mine into the ring. The Singapore MRT has long been one of my fave metro systems around the world. 

I like the concept of destination numbers and station numbers - I believe it is one of the first, if not the first, to use this concept (do let me know if that‚Äôs not quite right).  

My approach for this map is to incorporate the station number into the station marker itself to avoid some of the clutter associated placing the station name AND the number alongside the station marker.  

Also, I really wanted the Circle Line to be a circle, so I have adopted a few distortions to make that happen. Finally, I tried to incorporate geography of Singapore in a stylistic manner to further reinforce the circle motif. 

More info: http://transitmaps.tumblr.com/post/68121163229/singapore-bernie-ng

message+desc:
Madurai - Sacred confluence of religion and culture

The oldest existing city in the Indian peninsula and one of the oldest continuously inhabited cities in the world, Madurai is richly steeped in cultural heritage. The city, earlier known as Madhurapuri, grew around a huge temple built by Pandian King Kulasekhara 2,500 years ago. 

Madurai became famous during the Sangam period through the third and last conglomeration of Tamil scholars, which existed for more than 100 years. The city was the magnificent capital of Pandya kings and visited by travellers such as Megasthenes (302 BC), Pliny (77 AD), Ptolemy (140 AD), Marco Polo (1203 AD) and Ibu Batuta (1333 AD). Today, Madurai is synonymous with the awe-inspiring Meenakshi-Sundareswarar Temple 

 See more at: http://www.incredibleindia.org/travel/destination/madurai
comments: I have been here before.. it's a fantastic temple :)

message+desc:
‚ÄúYou live in a wonderful place. It has epic nature ‚Äì sea, mountains, greenery. The most incredible human endeavour and skyrises, steel and glass. But at the core, the most important thing, are the human beings, you.‚Äù 

Couldn‚Äôt have put it better ourselves, Benedict Cumberbatch! Welcome to Hong Kong, and wish you all the best with your movie, Marvel Studio‚Äôs Doctor Strange.
comments: Unaffordable real estate so most people waste all their money trying to put a roof over their head; nature ruined by big infrastructure projects that are just making big tycoons richer, and wasting taxpayer money; street-level retail bland and generic now, nothing but jewellery stores and milk-powder sellers, not for the locals; hordes of mainlanders everywhere ruining everything...$$So why do you stay there Jeremy Porter if you don't like it.  Your from Ontario. So why not go back home$$I lived there for 13 years,and miss it everyday. Wish I could afford to go back and live there xxx$$You're lucky to live there! Owen Grainger & Keys Keys x$$The lights the people the food all make Hong kong$$We'll be there in 3 weeks time but have been there before.

message+desc:
Shizuoka Festival (5 Apr. to 7 Apr.)
 
This festival derives from the history that General Ieyasu Tokugawa  in Edo era brought his loyal vassals to view cherry blossoms.
You can enjoy big historical parades and performance with full-blown cherry blossoms!
And on 7th, Disney characters will show up in a music parade as special guests! 
 
Shizuoka Festival is held at Shizuoka City (JR Shizuoka Station)
Check more info (PDF) ‚Üí„ÄÄhttp://www.jnto.go.jp/jpn/downloads/130327_shizuoka_festival.pdf

message+desc:
Have you ever been to anywhere known as a spiritual place in Japan?
In Japan, a location thought to be flowing with spiritual and sacred power, mystical energy place is called a ‚ÄúPower-Spot‚Äù and many people like to visit those places due to healing themselves. 
Takachiho City in Miyazaki prefecture is one of the most famous spiritual places with a lot of myths and legends. 
You can also enjoy to watching ‚ÄúYokagura‚Äù, traditional dance at Takachiho Shrine every night from 8 to 9 pm.
Related information;
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/regional/miyazaki/takachiho.html
http://takachiho-kanko.info/en/
http://takachiho-kanko.info/en/sightseeing/

comments: We have to remember that the object and centre of the Holy Mass is the Lord, not the priest nor the congregation. The Holy Mass is not for entertainment; it is for the glorification of God and for the sanctification of the Faithful. There is a proper time and place for everything; the Mass should be reserved for worship, not for unliturgical acts and greetings. Lastly, most of us are Roman Catholics, hence, we follow the Roman Rite. The Roman style of worship is rigid, concise, and solemn in nature. Clerics should not innovate and personalise the rituals in the Holy Mass. If it is not written in the rubrics and in liturgical documents, it should not be done. -- It's a blessing that the priest accepted his mistake. message+desc:
Where is it?
Taoist Temple, Cebu City

What is it like? 
The Cebu Taoist Temple was built in 1972 by the Chinese community. Both worshipers and non-worshipers are welcome to visit and see the colorful statues and structures. 

How to get there:
Fly into Cebu from Hongkong, Singapore, Narita, Incheon, or any major Philippine city.Or take a bus to Cebu from either Dumaguete or Bacolod. Or take your car via a Roll-On Roll-Off (RORO) ferry.Or take a boat to Cebu from Manila or any major city in Visayas and Mindanao.

Fun Fact:
While the rituals held in the temple are for devotees only, you can drop some coins at the wishing well for good fortune. 

Photo by/Author:
George Tapan/Brandon Dollente

Would you stay here?

As we cruised along the shoreline of San Vicente, we came across this little hut on the beach. Endless palms stack along each side and blend into the horizons, while the view overlooks the West, giving the opportunity to conclude each day to a private, stunning sundown. Words and Photo by Michael G. Quinn

message+desc:
Where is it? 
Lake Sebu, South Cotabato

What is it like? 
The T'boli Tribal Festival is an annual thanksgiving that's held every September in South Cotabato's Lake Sebu. Cultural dances, gong-playing, and ethnic sports like horsefighting are all part of this festival's program. This is a chance for the different tribes of the province to gather together with ethnic groups from Davao.

Fun Fact: 
The festival is held to honor the natives' belief in Lem-lunay ‚Äì a Camelot or paradise that they would like to make of their tribe.

Photo by/Author: 
Tourism Department Philippines/Donna Dimayuga
comments:
It's truly an amazing festival celebration of the T'bolis.$$I will visit hre...nxtym :)$$i've been there wayback 2008.. really amazing the sceneries,the 7 falls,,,boat riding in punta isla...sarap ng tilapia nla.$$what is the complete address of lake sebu$$Lake sebu, south cotabato$$I wanna see this festival. Amazing$$Yeeeehey,, before you going back to America Ading Vicki Esteban,$$aiming to be there this summer!$$I have been there! 

And I love it! :-)

message+desc:
Where is it?
Magellan's Cross, Cebu 

How to Get There:
Fly into Cebu from Hongkong, Singapore, Narita, Incheon, or any major Philippine city.

Or take a bus to Cebu from either Dumaguete or Bacolod. 

Or take your car via a Roll-On Roll-Off (RORO) ferry.

Or take a boat to Cebu from Manila or any major city in Visayas and Mindanao.

What is it?
Magellan's Cross commemorates Portuguese explorer Ferdinand Magellan's first contact with the people of Cebu on April 7, 1521. 

Fun Fact:
The original cross is actually encased within the planted wooden cross you see today, as a precaution against locals who chipped off small pieces for their rumoured healing properties.

Photo by / Headline by:
Jaime Singlador / Magnus Ahmad
comments: Ive been there. And I feel great.$$No, I beg to disagree, Cebuanos are one of the most honest Filipinos I know.$$try to visit here guyzzzzz,,,,,,:-)

message+desc:
Dragon Boat Innovate (DBI) is one of the leading team building companies in Singapore today, but their journey to success was hard fought.

Helm by Jason and Gavin, they worked in libraries and cafes during their first 2 years and Gavin was drawing a monthly salary of only $800 initially despite being an SMU grad. But they pushed through all of the obstacles to serve over 50,000 people and now have plans to expand regionally.

To celebrate SMEs which make up a surprising 99 per cent of businesses in Singapore, DBS has partnered us to put together a special series of videos as part of the 99% SME campaign launched by DBS and Singtel to support SMEs.

The campaign culminates with SME Week from 14 - 23rd Oct ‚Äì DBI is offering a special deal during SME Week where you can get 50% off their corporate introductory session! More details here: https://www.99sme.sg/deal-detail/?id=802

Head over to www.99sme.sg/special-deals to find out more. #SupportOurSMEs

Model: Qianling Chowster

message+desc: #StreetFood Challenge! There are tons of street food that can be found all over #Korea at very affordable prices. Have you tried them all? Which is your favorite street food? *Yumm* #VisitKorea
comments:
My favourite Hotteok is made from buckwheat flour which is healthier. Another version is made from sweet potato flour which is just as delicious. Some vendors even add pinenut seeds.
Generally hotteoks dont cost more than 1000 won each unless you're at Myeongdong.
I usually get my sweet potato hotteok at Jongno at 3 for only 2000 won. message+desc: Puso (pu-so) is rice wrapped and steamed in woven coconut leaves. Originally from Cebu, this traditional way of serving rice makes it a convenient and perfect partner for barbecue, lechon or other streetside food. Not to be confused with the other word "puso" or heart, although rice IS close to every Pinoy's heart. Photo taken from outoftownblog.com

message+desc:
"Joya no Kane" 
In Japan, Buddhist temple bells are rung 108 times beginning at midnight on New Year‚Äôs Eve.
Why 108 times? One explanation for the bell-ringing is that this is done to forswear the 108 human desires.
Some temples allow ordinary people to ring their bells, so check the temples near you if you are in Japan. Or hear the sound of the bells and welcome the New Year!
More information: http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/indepth/exotic/JapanesQue/1112/newyear.html

Mamee is not just a snack, it is THE snack of our formative years. It is no wonder that we went crazy when we chanced upon the world's only Mamee themed cafe, right at Jonker Street, Malacca. With all styles of noodle dishes cooked with the signature Mamee noodle, and cute Mamee merchandise for sale, it's a must-see if you ever visit the cultural city of Malaysia!

There are also workshops available for the Mamee fanatic, and you can even customize cup noodles for your friends back home.

Find out more about this cafe here: http://thesmartlocal.com/read/mamee-malacca

message+desc:
Where is it?
Palawan

What is it?
Club Paradise Resort is surrounded by a house reef which is easily accessible to divers and has a diverse marine system. Near this reef is the feeding ground of sea turtles and dugongs (sea cows) ‚Äì the gentle giants of the sea. There are tours that take you along the coast of Busuanga for some dugong-watching.

How to get there? 
Fly into Puerto Princesa from Busuanga, Cebu, Davao, Iloilo or Manila. 

Fun Fact: 
Some believe that stories of mermaids came about when lonely sailors spotted dugongs swimming in the ocean, and mistook their shape as that of half-woman, half-fish creatures.

Photo by/Headline by:
George Tapan/Tin Sanchez

If you love to dive, then you must plunge into the translucent waters of Bali‚Äôs Nusa Penida island. This is a favorite amongst divers because of its colorful and unique underwater treasures. Here is where you can swim alongside the weird yet wonderful Mola-mola Fish and Manta Rays. Fun fact? Nusa Penida is known as a cleaning station for the unique Mola-Mola fish, also known as ocean sunfish. #WonderfulIndonesia

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ivMnt7WH_EYWonderful Indonesia Locations: - Pulau Merah, Banyuwangi - Tj Balangan, Jimbaran, Bali - Savana Alas Purwo, Banyuwangi - Pasih Uug, Nusa Penida, Bali - Angle...

message+desc: Who loves bacon? Alam niyo ba that there is a district called Bacon in Sorsogon? It boasts of a handful of beaches, islands and this secluded lagoon called Paguriran. Be a More Fun advocate and share with your friends who like bacon!
comments: What a nice cove... May I know where this is?$$It's in Sorsogon. The lagoon is called Paguriran. :D$$You have to wear water shoes as the jagged/sharp limestone surrounding the lagoon would really hurt your feet. You can either swim from the shore or ride a banca which takes only a few minutes. You may see corals, small fish of different species, some crustacean such as crabs, also seashells attached to the limestone. Some people have a picnic there but unfortunately they leave some of their stuff which ruins the place. I hope this issue has been addressed. Its been a few years since I visited. The lagoon is quite small but very picturesque and on a clear day, you'll see Mayon Volcano in the distance. It's about an hour from Sorsogon City to Bario Sawanga where the lagoon is located just off shore. The road is paved so its quite easy to get there. It's worth a visit!

message+desc:
It's A-Boat Time!

Running on it‚Äôs 5th year, Sea-Expo is a three day boat show and nautical lifestyle event that celebrates the Philippine‚Äôs most valuable natural resource, the ocean. 

It is the only event in the country where the local and international marine industry come together to showcase their products and services to the Philippine market. The goal: to be recognized as a serious market and as a viable sector for development and investments. 

Sea-ex also aims to promote tourism by being a destination event at par with other boat shows held by it‚Äôs
Asian neighbors. 

Visit http://www.facebook.com/philseaexpo for more details.

message+desc:
Today‚Äôs photos are of peach blossoms in Japan.
While viewing cherry blossoms, or Sakura, is the most iconic springtime activities in Japan, there are other, less mainstream blossoms that are worthy of your attention too. The peach blossoms offer more a vibrant color and a sweeter aroma! This seasonal sensory experience is not one to be missed!
Related information; http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/attractions/rest/hana/hana_p4.html

message+desc:
Lacquerware, or ‚ÄúShikki‚Äù in Japanese, refers to tableware and personal ornaments made of wood, or bamboos. The oldest know lacquerware in Japan was excavated from 9000-year-old ruins, which suggests that lacquerware has been a part of Japanese life since the olden days. 
Today there are many lacquerware-producing regions all across the country.
Learn more: http://japan-magazine.jnto.go.jp/en/1606_pottery.html

message+desc:
Where is it?
Coron, Palawan

How to Get There:
Fly from Manila to Busuanga, then transfer to a van bound for Coron.

What is it?
Coron‚Äôs many lagoons are surrounded ‚Äì and sometimes hidden ‚Äì by towering limestone hills. Some lagoons have tiny openings that visitors must swim under to reach.

Fun Fact:
Coron offers many island hopping eco-tours. Ask your boatman to include a seaside lunch of fresh seafood!

Photo by / Headline by:
Joey Rico / Rachel Teotico
comments: Its more fun in the philippines$$Don't miss out on this Sarah Marie!$$Next trip I'm going there$$You'll be gobsmack by the scenery.$$puerto princesa palawan.nice and beautiful..a safe place..ive stay here for almost 9yrs...more fun in the philippines$$Yeah have been here before with my late lovely wife, daughter Emily & niece Luchi Teodoro beautiful place....$$More or less how much do i have to spend to reach coron from manila. Board and lodging for two for three days. Including air fare.

message+desc:
Great Hwangam Tomb, the largest tomb in Korea. If you take a closer look at it, you'll see that it is not a single tomb but is actually two linked mounds. A tomb like this one is considered the tomb of a married couple.

The tomb complex of Daereungwon has a large number of old tombs of famous kings and aristocrats >>> http://bit.ly/X7fmCK

message+desc: Raja Ampat : Ultimate Underwater Expedition http://bit.ly/a3rx7U The roaring engines fixed to a large wooden boat are finally quiet. message+desc:
Where is it?
Samar, Eastern Visayas

How to Get There:
Fly from Manila to Calbayog or Tacloban.

Or take a bus from Manila to Tacloban.

Or take a boat from Cebu to Calbayog or Ormoc.

What is it?
Samar is always wet, with downpours throughout the year. No wonder the region's rainforests are lush and healthy.

Fun Fact:
Spanish explorer Ruy Lopez de Villalobos set foot on the island in 1543 and named it Las Islas Filipinas.

Photo by / Headline by:
George Tapan / Denise Tolentino
comments: so wonderful and very amaze to see the  beuty of our country.....wow$$It's more fun in the Philippines!!!!!!$$Proud to be waray hehehe maupay it mga lugar ha samar hehehe

message+desc:
If you are the sort who eats chilli crab only for the zhap, then feast on Nassim Hill's CHILLI CRAB PASTA instead. 

Drenched in chilli crab gravy, this pasta dish is a treat to all who love the spicy kick of chilli crab but are too lazy to spend the whole night cracking crab shells. Jio all your drinking kakis here because they've also got an extra long happy hour period from 9am to 9pm daily!

What's more, DBS/POSB Cardholders get one additional main dish free on top of 3 main dishes ordered after 4pm!

message+desc:
#Bukchon Hanok Village, where the view of the #traditional hanok houses juxtaposed with the city #skyline in the background is regarded one of the most scenic sites in #Seoul! Bits of #cute decorations or #mural paintings in between alleys can also be found here. What do you like most about #BukchonHanokVillage? Let us know! ^_^ #VisitKorea

For more info ‚òû bit.ly/KTO_Bukchon
comments: Miss this place a lot...wonderful, nostalgic and superbly enchanting....take slow walk..go early morning...cool and serene...very quiet and peaceful.....get a cuppa of hot coffee and take your time exploring this place...immersed yourself completely in a world that time forgotten......at the entrance area of this village, lots of eateries and shops...wonderful sights....magical atmosphere......you'll come back again.....especially coffee shops with beautiful gardens.....sigh.....$$Took this there, at the highest point I could reach‚ô°$$i like the view of first picture the most...hanok + NSeoul tower from afar...and also the "Sang Go Jae" house from Personal Taste shooting place of  Lee Min Ho & Son Ye Jin's Drama <3$$A place which I will revisit the next trip i go to Seoul.  The walk, the scenery, the unique houses...everything  is so awesome!$$One of the places I 'd love to visit ...... to stay during  the night....dreaming.....$$These kind of houses are beautiful ... I really like them...$$Merissa Ri we going here hopefully$$Been here for filming locations of Kdrama Personal Taste house of Lee Min Ho and for Heartstring of CNBlue Yonghwa and Park Shin Hye. Enjoyed walking through the Hanok houses in the middle of the city.$$Hi, is there somewhere at Bukchon Hanok Village where we can have a Hanbok trial experience and also kimchi making? Thanks!$$Nomu Ju ah yo... fresh smell of Korean Pine must permeates in the air around this beautiful traditional village. l wish to be here someday with Catherine Lim coz she also like Hanok.$$I'd love to see this place in another season!!! #please

message+desc:
Where is it?
Camiguin Island, Mindanao

How to Get There:
"Fly from Manila to Cagayan de Oro.

Or take a boat from Manila, Iloilo, or Cebu to Cagayan de Oro.

Then take a bus to Balingoan, and then a boat to Camiguin Island."

What is it?
Camiguin is known as "the island born of fire" because of its seven volcanoes. It‚Äôs a less touristy site, with most visitors coming to see White Island ‚Äì a sandbar with a view of Hibok-Hibok Volcano and Mt. Vulcan.

Fun Fact:
Camiguin is the second-smallest island-province in the Philippines.

Photo by / Headline by:
Joey Rico / Rachel Teotico
comments: chill,beautiful place $$Been there! Nice place!$$Malapit lng yand2 smin...come&visit our camiguin island still so much more fun here..we have soda water pool,cold spring pool,waterfalls&a clean beaches...the true beauty of nature is just here in camiguin island$$a peaceful and romantic place CAMIGUIN ISLAND the place were i belong.. #likelikelike <3$$i love the place, the sand bar and the hotspring. .unforgetable experiences! ^^,$$Hope to be my next summer vacation destination....$$it's more fun in the PHILIPPINES tlga

message+desc: If you adore vintage trinkets or unique antiques, then you should travel to Solo in Central Java and drop by the Triwindu Antique Market. Here, it's antiques galore for those who seek rare old objects, from tiny accessories to old fashioned bicycles. And, the best part? This market still adopts the barter system so you can trade off your own antiques for another piece in the store. If you want to know more about Triwindu Antique Market, click here http://indonesia.travel/en/destination/point-of-interest/triwindu-antique-market #WonderfulIndonesia

message+desc:
Where is it?
Siargao, Surigao del Norte

How to Get There:
"Fly from Manila to Surigao, then take a boat to Siargao.

Or take a bus from Manila or Davao to Surigao, then take a boat to Siargao.

Or take a boat from Manila to Surigao, then take a boat to Siargao."

What is it?
Cloud 9 in Siargao Island is one of the world‚Äôs best surf breaks, with a reputation for thick, hollow tubes. The island is also known for its relatively cheap food and accommodations.

Fun Fact:
The site was discovered in the 1980s by travelling surfers. It was named after a local chocolate bar.

Photo by / Headline by:
Donald Tapan / Rachel Teotico

Just take a plane/boat to Cebu and take a 45min flight to siargao...$$It's beautiful and cool.  Mabuhay Siargao.$$Its my home town luv it$$Ill try to surf there.$$I'll lyk 2 visit that beautifvl site insha Allah$$nice place. The surfing capital of the philippines.

MAN üë® VS. COMPUTER üíª 
#Baduk Î∞îÎëë, also known as #Go Game, is an ancient Chinese boardgame using black and white playing pieces, called "stones".  
Korea's legendary #baduk player, Lee Sedol, will be competing against #DeepMind's computer program #AlphaGo in a $1M 5-game #challenge match in #Seoul. AlphaGo is known to be the first computer program ever to beat a professional Go player by winning 5-0 against a European Champion last year. The first match will begin today at 1PM (KST) and #livestreaming available on YouTube! Who do you think would win the game? Let us know in the comments below! :D

message+desc:
Who‚Äôs from Calamba, Laguna? Raise your hand! There‚Äôs a directional sign of your hometown in the town of Wilhemsfeld, Germany. The sign was erected in honor of our national hero, Jose Rizal, who hails from Calamba ‚Äì and who stayed a few months in Wilhemsfeld. Danke schoen! 

http://www.wheninmanila.com/look-to-pay-tribute-to-rizal-germany-has-a-city-of-calamba-sign/In 1886, Jose Rizal celebrated his 25th birthday in Wilhelmsfeld, Germany. In this quaint town, he celebrated his special day with a Lutheran minister, Karl Ulmer, and his family. Unknown to many, the Germans have deep attachment with Rizal. Apparently, our national hero is still remembered there. I...
comments:
sa Heidelberg, Germany may statue si Rizal at street..Jose Rizal strasse. at may sign board sa isang house where he stayed as a student of Opthometry in Heidelberg University.$$I'm from Calamba laguna nice place. I miss my mother and sisters ...$$Me! Thank you for recognizing our city. I miss my family living there...I'll be back!  :)$$Come and Visit Us .. Much More Fun in Cebu Philippines ...We are DELIGHTED to SERVE you with a ..SMILE$$This is  made possible because Calamba and Wilhelmsfeld (Baden-Wuerttemberg) are sister-cities since 2008. By apparent historical reasons, Calamba is the birth place of Dr. Jose P. Rizal while Wilhelmsfeld is the small town where Rizal stayed with Pastor Ullmer to obtain a better appreciation of Germany (its culture and people).  As a tribute to Rizal, Wilhelmsfeld provides the venue for the only Rizal Park in Germany where annual pilgrimage by Knights of Rizal and Ladies for Rizal chapters from all over Europe congregate to commemorate Rizal's birth as well as death anniversaries (in June and December, respectively).$$The Germans have long loved the Philippines.$$WOW! thank you Wilhemsfeld, Germany..$$I'm from city of calamba. message+desc:
Where is it? 
Banaue Rice Terraces, Ifugao

What is it like? 
A lot of traditional villages can be found scattered throughout the rice terraces. Visit the Tam-an, Bocos, Batad, and Bangaan villages to immerse in the culture of this region.

How to get there: 
Take a bus bound for Banaue from Sampaloc. 

Or take a bus bound for Baguio from Cubao or Pasay, then transfer to a bus bound for Banaue.

Fun Fact: 
If you were traveling in the Philippines, you‚Äôd most likely be carrying the Banaue Rice Terraces in your pocket. The image of the site can be found at the back of the new P20 bill.

Photo by/Headline by: 
George Tapan/Brandon Dollente
comments: Nice pix, love it! But isn't it "OASIS"? instead of Oases? Mabuhay Philippines! More fun in the Philippines!!! :-)$$Been there - beautiful$$I think ang plural form ng oasis is oases.$$http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=l0I6vdR0SYI&list=PLZNUgddUqYyYVBBrYzehZxjWztbbRNBHD&index=4

message+desc:
Let‚Äôs take a look into the intricate and complex world of origami, which is so much more than a children‚Äôs pastime.
Over the years Japanese people started enjoying the act of folding paper itself without the formality and rules associated with gift wrapping, resulting in the ‚ÄúOrigami‚Äù we see today. Now Origami is enjoyed all over the world and continues to evolve. 

Learn more: http://japan-magazine.jnto.go.jp/en/1606_origami.html

message+desc: The Philippines has the world‚Äôs longest discontinuous coastline (34,600 km). That's pretty long! That means we have lots of beaches! Roll call: name the beaches you love going to in the country at the comment section!
comments: Canada has the longest. Indonesia's is also longer than the Philippines'. What's with the misinformation?$$We got our information from a study conducted by Joan Regina Castro of the Path Foundation Philippines and other websites that confirm this. In fact, the Institute of Public Information Canada has an article that begins with "The Philippines, with the longest discontinuous coastline in the world..." So, we didn't want to go against the experts! Canada and Indonesia might have a longer uninterrupted or unbroken coastline, but in the whole world, we have the longest, discontinuous coastline. At least that's recognized. :D$$Sta Cruz Island where the sand is pink..$$No doubt, we have the longest discontinuous coastline. Just add up all the beachlines of the 700+ big and small islands that constitute the archipelago.

message+desc:
Where is it? 
Anilao, Batangas

What is it like? 
The town of Anilao may not have white sand beaches, but its underwater environment is its biggest attraction. Dubbed as the birthplace of scuba diving in the Philippines, its deep waters teem with marine life and an abundance of corals and reefs. For non-divers ‚Äì the shallow and low-current waters are great for snorkeling. Dive and Trek's house reef is a marine sanctuary frequented by several snorkelers.

Fun Fact: 
Diving conditions in Anilao are ideal for divers of all experience levels. The water temperature is consistently warm, and the surface is typically calm and smooth throughout the year.

Photo by/Author: 
Tanya Burnett/Donna Dimayuga
comments: Yasashii Merrill If you know what i mean

message+desc:
Where is it? 
Bantayan Island, Cebu

What is it like? 
Bantayan once served as a Spanish base against Moro invasions. That's why a walk around can transport you centuries back. You can see traces of its heritage in the old Spanish-era houses and dilapidated fort ruins. Mangroves and palm trees line the shores of Sugar Beach, Paradise Beach and Virgin Island.

Fun Fact: 
This island's watchtowers gave it the name ‚ÄúBantayan sa Hari‚Äù (Watchtower of the King). This was later shortened to ‚ÄúBantayan,‚Äù the name it's known as today.

Photo by/Author: 
George Tapan/Donna Dimayuga

message+desc:
Where is it? 
Batangas, Luzon

What is it like? 
Habulan ng baboy (chasing the pig) is a traditional game played by children. A piglet is set free and players chase it around to catch it ‚Äî not with a lasso, but with their bare hands. Whoever grabs hold of the the piglet, wins the piglet. 

Fun Fact: 
Batangas holds the Palaro ng Lahi (traditional games) so that young people can continue to enjoy the tradition of outdoor games amidst an era of high-tech toys.

Photo by/Author: 
Rudy Liwanag/Tin Sanchez

If don't hurt the pig, I like.$$Not fun or funny at all, the poor piglet will be terrified!!! üò§üò§üò§$$and EATS it!! hmmm....LECHON!! :D$$Greased pig contest there too!$$It's really more fun in the Philippines.$$They used to do that with a greased up pig .tih kids would have all sorts of fun 
Also goat cart races and billy goat riding . The stupid animal liberationists and workplace health and safety idiots had them banned .nowcthe only thing that they afecalowed to do is watching tv and video games.

comments: Where is that view from please? I would like to go there when I visit?$$Spent 3 weeks there on HMS Whitby while stationed in the Far East Fleet, great run ashore at Christmas 1970.USS Enterprise was also there anchored in the harbour while away from the Vietnam war at the time.Great memories of the trip.$$I loved my stay in Hong Kong in 1996 shortly before Hong Kong was handed back to China. I stayed at the Newton Hotel which was ideally placed for its great views of Hong Kong Harbour, and seeing the British Warships in the Harbour. Chris Pattern was the British Governor there at the time, and it was great seeing the British Flag flying on the top of the Governors Residence. I will never forget the plane I was arriving in flying really close to the flats near to the Old Kai Tak Airport where I landed. The pilot really needed to be experienced to land at this airport. The attached picture shown overlooking Hong Kong at the Peak was where I stood and had photo's taken. My Love of Hong Kong will always remain deep in my heart, but the Hong Kong of today is not the same. You cannot re-create that Era, and the Vibe that existed at that time. I would go again without doubt!$$Lived there early 80's.. Osborne Barracks Kowloon, then Stanley Fort Hong Kong Island.. Loved it,,wish I could go back, would love to see what changes have been made since the Handover..$$we'ved been  there 2x was so amazing tramp ride,shopping, the buildings n exotic foods, cleanest city like singapor, love it, but expensive.$$We had a wonderful stay , never saw so much stuff for sale at such cheap prices, I expect that has changed now. message+desc:
Okay I did not expect this. Great job Lee Bee Wah! It may not have been intentional, but because of the statement, a lot of people are aware about our water situation now.We can all agreet the statement on apprecaiting water was one of the silliest things we've heard. But let's think about it for a second. Did it actually work?

We asked people on the street whether the 30% hike in water prices will make them appreciate water more.

The answers will surprise you.
comments:
No.
But it makes people adjust their lifestyle.
What used to be generosity becomes petty.
What used to be socialising becomes occasion.
What used to be sharing becomes mind the bill!
It further distances society and increases selfishness and aloofness...
Sad outcomes.$$To make us appreciate oxygen more we should pay for fresh air too. What a distorted theory.$$Cut the MP salary 30% to make them appreciate their HIGH PAY job !!!$$Many people think they don't waste water..but probably a lot of people will think they wasted their vote....during last election

‚ñ∂ How to Participate  
Step 1: Upload a picture taken during your trip in Korea (Oct 2015-Sep 2016) onto your SNS (Facebook/Instagram) with hashtag #MyVisitKoreaStory

message+desc:
Owl and Giant panda deliver mail to you!
Ah‚Ä¶it's just a joke. These are unique postbox which you sometimes find in Japan.
The postbox's design is selected regarding the regional characteristic. 
For example, can you think the yellow post looks like owl? The yellow one is in Ikebukuro, Tokyo, called ‚ÄúIkefukuro‚Äù. 
Why? Because the pronunciation of Owl in Japanese, ‚ÄúFukuro‚Äù almost the same as Ike‚Äúbukuro‚Äù.

The white postbox is in Ueno, Tokyo. There is the Ueno Zoo where the two Giant pandas were brought first time in Japan, 1972.
Hikone City, Shiga prefecture has magnificent Hikone Castle and you can find unique mailbox with castle on the top.
When you visit Japan, it would be fun to find unique post!

Related Information;
Ikebukuro, Tokyo http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/regional/tokyo/ikebukuro.html
Ueno, Tokyo     http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/regional/tokyo/ueno.html
Hikone, Shiga Prefecture http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/regional/shiga/hikone.html
comments:
Another "only in Japan" thing?  Maybe.$$https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6fomj4apa3o$$Something new to me. No one tops Japan in the "kawaii" (cute) department.$$https://www.facebook.com/photo.php?fbid=10154014563355313&l=4fe0329462

I took this photo in Akasusa, if my memory serves me correctly. Love Pandas :D$$I know yellow and white postboxes!! ;)$$That's very playful! No way the German post office would ever do that...

Sweet potato, largely produced in Kagoshima prefecture in Kyushu.
For more information about local foods of the Kyushu region;
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/attractions/dining/food/jfood_10.html
Kawagoe city, Saitama prefecture is also famous for sweet potato.

message+desc:
Feel the greatness of ‚ÄúUnderground Parthenon‚Äù!
It is actually a water infrastructure located underground of Kasukabe, Saitama Prefecture.
Because the main water tank resembles Parthenon, the Metropolitan Area Outer Underground Discharge Channel is known as ‚ÄúUnderground Parthenon‚Äù and it‚Äôs the world largest flood water division facility.

If you are planning to visit metropolitan area of Japan, you may want to add an excursion to your itinerary!
From JR Tokyo station, take Shinkansen, bullet train to Omiya Station (25 min), then transfer to Minami Sakurai Sta. on Tobu Noda Line (30 min). „ÄÄ
From there, the facility is 3 km or about 1.9 miles ahead.

More Information:
http://www.ktr.mlit.go.jp/edogawa/gaikaku/english/index.html
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/regional/saitama/

message+desc:
Have you heard the name of the small island called Enoshima?
Enoshima is easy access from Tokyo, takes only one hour by train and also near Kamakura.

There is the Enoshima SeaCandle building and from the observation tower, a beautiful Mt. Fuji can be seen on a fine day. 
Let‚Äôs visit attractive Enoshima island during your stay in Tokyo and enjoy local food as well.
Related information:
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/regional/kanagawa/enosima.html

message+desc:
Any plans for Saturday night? How about staring at the starry sky? This video taken in Guyam Island, Siargao, even shows us the Milky Way! Not bad for a weekend night! 

https://www.facebook.com/travelimagez/videos/vb.195718967444442/255967028086302/?type=2&theaterTime lapse scene of the milky way behind Guyam island, Siargao, Philippines. 

Guyam is a small deserted island of the coast of Siargao near General Luna. The island is visited daily by visitors on a boattrip or who come to just chill out for a while. It's a perfect little island with no facilities exept a toilet and 2 shelters. For a small fee the owner will allow people to stay on the island overnight. I've been in Siargao for over 2 months, the vibe of the island and the beauty of the surrounding islands make Siargao and incredible and addicting island. For a while have I been planning the right time to visit this island during the time when the milky way would be visible √°nd when there would be no light pollution of the moon, also trying to lucky with clear weather. 

The milky is not visible like this with your own eyes, it is because of long exposure shots (20 seconds) that details of the milky way become visible and with postprocessing details and contrast are further enhanced. The settings used are ISO 1600, f2.8, shutterspeed of 20seconds. I used a D800 and 14-24mm lens, but any DSLR can capture this and even a good compact camera with RAW abilities.

Follow me on instagram @travelimagez
comments: This could be night time in Toronto if there is no lights. It's gorgeous$$Joanna could of done this in Baler if we'd been allowed out onto the beach üòÇüòÇ$$mga kuyas Richard.. Jeffrey.. Mark.. what do you think of this?..$$Beautiful. God did not make any of that.$$Watch this in full screen "Beautiful

message+desc:
22-year old Canadian Vlogger Christian LeBlanc travelled around Asia in 2015 for 7 and a half months and had this to say: 

"...Every country has unique things to offer, but the Philippines is, by far, my favorite. I've never met a kinder group of people and a more beautiful landscape. The blues of waters, the most exaggerated landscapes, there is just so much to do!

"My time in the Philippines was unforgettable and i loved it so much that i'll actually be going back in 2016."

Check out his HONEST review of his visit to some of the Philippines' top destinations, including Bohol, Cebu, Palawan, and Siquijor, through this Vlog and we hope you too get to experience how MORE FUN it is in the Philippines!

P.S. Just some minor corrections and suggestions:

(1) On the duration of tourist visa:
a foreign traveller can actually stay in the Philippines visa-free for 30 days and not 21 days, as stated in the video.

(2) The whole of Mindanao is not unsafe and there are equally beautiful touristic destinations one could visit in there such as Siargao, which is becoming a world surf haven; Cagayan de Oro, known for the wild river rafting; Davao, where the Philippines' highest peak, Mt. Apo, could be trekked; Camiguin, where you could swim in a carbonated water, and many more! :-)

#VisitPhilippinesAGAIN2016If anyone is planning to go traveling to Southeast Asia, consider adding The Philippines to your list! 

YouTube: Christian LeBlanc
Instagram: LostLeBlanc
Snapchat: LostLeBlanc

The Philippines was the highlight of my trip and I will definitely be back.
Hope this video helps!

#ThePhilippines #ItsMoreFunInThePhilippines #Travel
comments:
I agree with Christian Leblanc and after visiting the Philipinnes for 6 weeks in September/ October 2014, I am actually moving there in 3 weeks ( the 1st week of February) I cannot wait to be among those wonderful people!$$I absolutely love the Philippines , this is a a great video , I have done a few of the things Christian had done , Cebu , Bohol , Dumagete , I am returning in Feb to do a little more , Kawasan falls,  and Palawan , can't wait !!$$My visit to Manila and QC...truly changed my life... The wonderful food and the kind generous people. Who showed me that I didn't need possessions to be happy. I help some street kids...and for the first time in my life.... I give of myself without expecting anything in return...but my joy was priceless üôèüèº.  I came back to US... But I left my heart in the Philippines ....God bless the Philippines.... Pinoy pride....üëçüèªüëçüèªüíØ$$I love all about the Philippines, but most if all its people, will be going there for a few weeks soon <3$$I love that you have shared this video The Philippines... it was an awesome video and full of great info! I noticed that in your caption you have highlighted "Corrections"... I think it would be great if you included in this that Mindanao as a whole isn't unsafe, and that many areas in Northern Mindanao can happily be explored and experienced as any other areas in the country.  

For example:

Camiguin is technically part of Mindanao... Cagayan de Oro where I live is part of Mindanao... Siargao (one of the biggest backpacking islands) is part of Mindanao. 

It would be great if you "stuck up for Mindanao" in your caption as well.  

Have a great day.$$Dean JB, Filipino hospitality is second to none, sometimes to a fault. We will kill our last pig to serve to our guests. Not sure why despite our beautiful country and wonderful people, our tourist arrivals are last among the South East Asian countries. Perhaps more people like you spreading the word will make a difference. Thank you again for your kind words for our country.$$I'm in total agreement to what you have said, Philippines is my favorite place - in fact I love the Philippines. My first visit there was in 2012 - I have been there every year since - it's such a magical and majestic place!!!Every year I would choose a different Island to visit - each one as stunning and exciting as the last one. I'm going back this year for yet another enjoyable holiday!!$$Well done both of you and thank you for the video, the tourism Dept should hire you for marketing the Philippines and it is a beautiful place thanks$$Dennis, how about being back soon? :)$$WELCOME TO MY COUNTRY PHILIPPINES. WE HAVE A LOT OF BEAUTIFUL THINGS TO OFFER. AND MOST OF ALL THE HOSPITALITY OF THE FILIPINO PEOPLE. I AM PROUD TO BE A FILIPINO.$$Philippines great place to visit people friendly & helpful and been there two times the second time to get married to my Filipino wife which was the best thing I ever done and hope to move & live there soon in Palawan which is a beautiful place with lovely people$$I loved the Philippines when I was there. I'm trying to get back there this year. This country is so very beautiful and so are the people.$$Welcome to my country therr is do much beautiful places you csn enjoy  and you can experience the hospitality of the fipinos$$Not everyone in the Philippines are friendly. It just depends where you are and who you are with. You cannot go anywhere alone. This applies to almost anywhere in the world though.$$Absolutely wonderful video you take, but I have curious to the elephants. 
Where can I see that in the Philippines?$$i would suggest that you should visit mindanao as well.. try enchanted river..., lake holon.. lake sohoton... tinuy-an falls and etc... it is safe here...$$Our Country Philippines is beautiful but what makes it better? is the never ending hospitality of our people even if we are poor,God Bless!$$It's more fun in the Philippines!  :-*$$Just spent 2 weeks in the Philippines including trips to Bohol and Cebu plan on returning in a couple of months to see more, I'm thinking Palawan.  It's a beautiful place.$$nice video but it's a bit not wise, he miss the dumaguete and jumping into far places then went back expensively...$$Try to visit biliran island too... they hve lot of waterfalls,, white beaches,, and hospitality of people are very nice$$that's only 3% of the Philippines.. a lot more to see$$Come in philippines To have more fun !$$Wow. Very nice documentary on his experiences in the Philippines.$$very nice video but you missed many other places to visiting which are bagio and tagaytay

message+desc:
English version: At TSL, we're part of the Speak Good Singlish movement. Simply because we believe things around the world will get done lot more quicker if everyone spoke a bit of Singlish. 

Singlish version: Singlish best dun believe watch this video la.

SEE WHAT I MEAN!!

Also read: http://thesmartlocal.com/read/food-trends
comments:
That chope move!! #winliaolor XDD$$This is a long post but just wanted to let some of my fellow Singlishers know. (This was in response to someone's comment about Singlish being inferior to English).

Singlish is a totally separate language system from English. It is neither an "accented" English, "lazy/broken" English, nor a "dialect".

A language system is not only defined by its vocabulary but also its pragmatics and universal grammaticular and audinal rules, which Singlish satisfies.

If you don't believe what I'm saying, I recommend you to read up some thesis publications especially in "Language and Development" regarding the establishment of Singlish as an entire new language system, which has since gained steam post 2008s as the progress and knowledge of human language development blossomed. Some of these were written and taught by multiple professors when I was in NUS, and they (foreign lecturers) were behind the stand that Singlish was innately a language, not a dialect.

Having established this, it is only natural if a foreigner is unable to understand us whilst in Singapore, the same way I wouldn't understand Tagalog if I were in Philippines or any other country, simply because it is another LANGUAGE, not a corruption of English.

I truly feel that Singaporeans need to take ownership of our beloved native language and enjoy its usage to the maximum. Do not be ashamed of it and do not let anyone make you feel that Singlish is inferior to English because it is not.

Cheers to all the Singlish speakers out there.$$Not bad but not a very accurate representation. The guy is just lo sor, nothing to do with singlish v english$$Still don sound natural leh.... espiacially wen ordering mcdonald. Gd effort  but abit over liao... :p$$I see, thats why i wasnt able to blend in when i was there lmao!$$Let me rephrase the Singlish version of the description in proper English that's equally short (8 words).

"Singlish's the best. Watch this if in doubt."$$Cariissa CC For the couple just now, don't understand chope right?! sb annoying. lol$$Ashley Lim Wow Mcdonalds is going all out to promote the burger...$$Whats with the can, can and can liao sia. So unnatural leh$$This explains so much!! Watch till the end Nicole Moussa Anthony Lown$$Jasper Tan this is the video that I told you this morning! Lol$$we cut things short...the art of summarisation.lol$$Dangerous place for time wasters! Nice one! #comeiclapforyou$$Lol. The last part with all those tissue papers.$$That chop... Omg epic.. #likeaboss$$Lol I didn't know cte pie can come out ecp 1 Hahaha$$I would try to avoid saying things like " can liao"$$I am not so sure about that.

message+desc: The Potala Palace in Lhasa, Tibet and among the #silkroad is featured in Cond√© Nast Traveler's 15 Most Beautiful Museums in the World list! #travelOnce the home to the Dalai Lama, this towering 17th-century structure now functions as a state museum. The massive palace has 13 stories and more than 1,000 rooms, as well as centuries-old shrines. For those willing to ascend the 12,000+-foot climb, the main payoff will be the complex's otherwor‚Ä¶
comments: The name Lhasa means 'place of the gods' and it remains a vivid and still-thriving enclave of devout Buddhism. 425 ft above the city on Red Mountain stands the fortress-like Potala Palace, 13 storeys high and with 1,000 rooms filled with statues,chapels, manuscripts and murals. Potala was the winter palace of the Dalai Lamas and Tibet's political and spiritual headquarters for centuries. http://buff.ly/1TzcGeT

message+desc:
Where is it? 
University of the Philippines, Diliman, Quezon City

What is it like?
Sorbetes, the traditional ice cream in the Philippines, is commonly peddled by men called ‚Äúsorbeteros.‚Äù They push colorful carts and ring bells to signal their presence. The usual flavors include taro, cheese, and chocolate.

How to get there: 
Fly into Manila through one of more than 30 international airlines. You can also fly in from any major Philippine city.Or take a bus from any major city in Luzon.Or take a boat from any major Philippine port. Then take a taxi, jeepney or bus to Quezon City.

Fun Fact: 
Ice cream peddlers have become so popular in Filipino culture, that there's a popular song about them entitled ‚ÄúMamang Sorbetero‚Äù (Mister Ice Cream Man).

Photo by/Author: 
Rizza Garcia/Brandon Dollente
comments:
i am here maried to my lovely wife$$Mamang sorbetero , we love your ice cream$$My granddaughter is studying there now...UP Diliman :)$$Enjoyed seeing the colorful carts, and hearing the bell ring. Favorite ice cream sandwich in a bun yummy!$$Ian Jefferson Llanes Rockymore Please refrain from posting ads here to avoid being banned. Thank you.$$Love Philippine ice cream!!!! Ube and mango are the best!!!! And many more!!!!

message+desc:
Do you know three great gardens of Japan? 
The answer is "Kenrokuen Garden"(Ishikawa Pref.), "Korakuen Garden"(Okayama Pref.), and "Kairakuen Garden"(Ibaraki Pref.), which are well-known for their beautiful scenery. 
         
This picture is taken at Kenrokuen garden where you can see triangle-shaped trees called Yukizuri which is a technique for preserving trees from heavy snowfalls. It can be seen around the areas that have heavy snow in winter. Kenrokuen garden is also a popular spot of Yukizuri, and will start illuminated from Feb. 3rd. It is definitely worth visiting!!
 
For more information: http://hot-ishikawa.jp/f-lang/pdf/2011winter/2011winter_en_14.pdf
Ishikawa Prefecture Tourism Guide: http://hot-ishikawa.jp/f-lang/english/

Cheers, from Indonesia www.liburanmurah.info$$that most beautiful scenery, every photo that comes out here the more I love Japan a luxury$$I love this place. It is so beautiful in winter. A highlight of my trip!$$Best country in the all world!$$i;ve been to kenroukuen.. is awesome$$I always love snow scene... but I am afraid of the cold.  Not because of the temperature, but the pain it brings$$I hope I can go to the three great garden.

message+desc:
Where is it?
Palawan, Visayas

What is it?
Club Paradise Resort is surrounded by a house reef which is easily accessible to divers and has a diverse marine system. Near this reef is the feeding ground of sea turtles and dugongs (sea cows) ‚Äì the gentle giants of the sea. There are tours that take you along the coast of Busuanga for some dugong-watching.

How to get there? 
Fly into Puerto Princesa from Busuanga, Cebu, Davao, Iloilo or Manila. 

Fun Fact: 
Some believe that stories of mermaids came about when lonely sailors spotted dugongs swimming in the ocean, and mistook their shape as that of half-woman, half-fish creatures.

Photo by/Headline by:
George Tapan/Tin Sanchez
comments:
Seriously, I did not know Palawan is now in Visayas.
Please look into this. Thank you. ^^

message+desc:
Do you know what is special about March 3rd?
HINAMATSURI, or also known as Girl's Day is a special day in Japan and people celebrate each year on March 3rd with displaying special dolls called ‚ÄúHina doll‚Äù.
Today, let's showing you two venues of HINAMATSURI.
First, Kitsuki Hina Doll Festival in Oita Prefecture. It's already started until March 15.

And the next, ‚ÄúBikkuri Hinamatsuri‚Äù in Konosu City, Saitama prefecture.
This city is famous for its ‚ÄúHina doll‚Äù factories and you can also see the process of making the doll at this event up to March 7th from 9am to 5pm (weekday) or 9am to 4pm (weekend).
 
Related information;
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/attractions/event/traditionalevents/a70b_fes_hina.html
http://japan-magazine.jnto.go.jp/en/1203_dolls.html
http://www.kit-suki.com/common/index.php?action=story&story_id=200
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/spot/castles/kitsuki.html

message+desc:
Japanese hand-made paper, ‚ÄúWASHI‚Äù is shortlisted for UNESCO Intangible Culture Heritage status and will be decided this month, November.

By the way, do you know how to make ‚ÄúWASHI‚Äù? 
It is traditionally made by hand, using the bark of the ‚ÄúGampi‚Äù tree, ‚ÄúMitsumata‚Äù and ‚ÄúKozo‚Äù fiber.
Look at following photos which are showing you some making process, and the yellow flower of ‚ÄúMitsumata‚Äù.
Japanese paper making lessons are available at Gokayama, Toyama Prefecture or Higashi-chichibu, Saitama Prefecture etc., and don‚Äôt you think this will be of one of the great unforgettable memories of Japan to you?
(Gokayama)http://www.tabi-nanto.jp/en/experience/michinoeki_taira_gokayama_washi_no_sato_japanese_paper_making.html
(Higashi-chichibu)http://www.sainokuni-kanko.jp/eng/experience/053.html

Related information;
Echizen Washi, Fukui Prefecture http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/spot/handcrft/echizenwashi.html

http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/regional/gifu/mino.html

http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/spot/handcrft/inshuwashi.html

http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/spot/museum/paper.html

message+desc:
These Primary School Questions Our Kids Go Through Will Horrify You.

Oh dear, this is quite shocking. These questions may explain why Singaporeans have so much trouble with the education system.

http://mustsharenews.com/primary-school-questions/These questions may explain why Singaporeans have so much trouble with the unforgiving education system.
comments:
It depends. Some like to know why - that is the basis of science.$$The teacher is/was the perfect candidate for government  sector. Very losoh, repetitive and stating the redundant to ensure absolute absolute  clarity of understanding, comprehension and grasp of the obvious problem by the student, a kid, of 10 yrs of either boy or girl which is the opposite  of a boy$$Is it the teacher? Looks like the same person marked it, and that teacher obviously likes precision and details.$$Well, I would have failed if I took my psle now. Wtf.$$I think it's just this particular teacherr bah.
But from the perspective of thoroughness, then the student's answer is really too sketchy and does not address the principles directly, ie path of light, water is drawn through the roots. It's like the sort of analysis that mixes up cause, effect, and side effect in statistical studies.
But i agree the ball volume vs space one is ridiculous, both terms are practically interchangeable, and the logical assumption that this volume will displace water is too intuitive that teachers should not expect students to explain explicitly

message+desc:
Where is it? 
Siargao, Surigao del Norte

What is it like? 
The Philippines isn‚Äôt a major surf destination yet. That means more waves for you. We recommend hitting the beaches of Siargao, the country's surfing capital. Its popular surfing points have interesting names: Jack Horse, Quiksilver and the famous Cloud 9 ‚Äî known for its thick, perfect hollow tubes. It‚Äôs only been a few decades since American surf enthusiasts brought their boards to the Philippines, but our beaches have really taken to surf culture. As they should. They‚Äôve got water and waves to spare.

Fun Fact: 
International surfers call Cloud 9's perfect tubes as "the special wave." The wave was discovered by traveling surfers in the late 1980s. It was named and made famous by American photographer John S. Callahan.

Photo by/Author: 
Tourism Department Philippines/Donna Dimayuga
comments: Jovz Salgado lets go there and get surfing! ;)$$been there.its an amazing place

message+desc: Surrounded by pavilions, towers, arches and cupolas, Udaipur Palace or City Palace, is a fine blend of Rajasthani, Mughal, medieval, Chinese and European architecture. Built on the banks of the serene Pichola Lake, the palace complex comprises the Mubarak Mahal (the palace of reception) and the Maharani‚Äôs Palace (the palace of the queen). Mubarak Mahal is home to the Maharaja Sawai Man Singh II Museum and displays a unique and extensive collection of royal costumes, Pashmina silk, Benarasi silk saris, and others with Sanganeri prints and folk embroidery.

Comprising of 7 new container themed eateries, it has everything from a local tze-char selling Hotplate Sambal Sting Ray to a dessert stall selling Durian Sherbet. Be warned, waiting times can be quite long and we had difficulty getting seats when we went.

message+desc:
Where is it? 
Samal Island, Davao

What is it like? 
The Monfort Bat Cave in Samal Island, Davao is known to be the home of at least 2 million local fruit bats. It is the largest bat colony in the world as recorded by the Guinness World Records. 

Fun Fact: 
The Philippines is home to 26 indigenous bat species. That's more than any other country. We have the world‚Äôs largest and smallest bats ‚Äì the giant golden-crowned flying fox fruit bat and the lesser bamboo bat.  

Photo by/Author: 
Miguel Teotico/Rachel Teotico
comments: Had been to one of the caves in Mt. Province during a provincial assignment with the Department of Agriculture. Know what?  The provincial coordinator made me eat a "roasted bat"...

message+desc:
If you want a glimpse of Seoul through the eyes of expats and their interests, we highly recommend this show called Semipermanent. The program is part travel series, part cultural documentary, and the aim is to tell the stories of interesting people, discover new areas in the city, and share some of things to love about Seoul. 

You can watch it on ArirangWorld or you can watch the full episodes on Semipermanent's Facebook page >>> http://on.fb.me/VpGKuQ
